prompt: Panel 01 - Courtyard kickoff: Dora-explorer-inspired but original style, bright pastel hospital courtyard at Mayo Clinic Jacksonville, three Latin American research interns (Camila from Ecuador, Camilo and Diego from Colombia) wearing explorer badges, holding clipboards, large friendly aorta diagram on an easel, speech bubbles: Camila “Hola! Ready to map Type 2 endoleaks?”, Camilo “Sí, exploremos los caminos ocultos!”, Diego “Dr. Erben quiere datos claros.”
alt_text: Courtyard: three Latino research interns in explorer gear near Mayo Clinic, aorta diagram on easel, speech bubbles launching the mission.

prompt: Panel 02 - Goal map: Whiteboard as treasure map with aneurysm sac drawing and arrows to side branches, interns pointing with markers, speech bubbles: Diego “Objetivo: 30+ escenas, todo claro.” Camila “La historia debe explicar sola.” Camilo “Los globos llevan la ciencia.”
alt_text: Whiteboard treasure map showing aneurysm sac and branch arrows, interns pointing with markers.

prompt: Panel 03 - Define Type 2: Close-up aorta cutaway and aneurysm sac, small lumbar artery feeding retrograde flow with dotted arrow, speech bubbles: Camilo “Tipo 2 = flujo retrógrado desde ramas.” Camila “No es fuga del sello, son colaterales.”
alt_text: Aorta cutaway with aneurysm sac and dotted retrograde arrow from lumbar branch explaining Type 2.

prompt: Panel 04 - Flow mechanism: Magnified lumbar artery inflow swirling into sac, playful arrows, spine landmarks, speech bubbles: Diego “Lumbar o IMA alimentan, presión mantiene perfusión.” Camilo “El riesgo depende del crecimiento.”
alt_text: Magnified lumbar artery feeding sac with swirling flow and spine landmark backdrop.

prompt: Panel 05 - Risk signal: Cartoon sac with measuring tape and green check vs red arrow >5 mm, speech bubbles: Camila “Saco estable? Observamos.” Diego “Si crece >5 mm, intervenimos.”
alt_text: Sac cartoon with measuring tape; green stable vs red >5 mm growth marker.

prompt: Panel 06 - Imaging plan: Friendly CTA scanner with checklist bubbles “arterial phase”, “delayed phase”, “find source vessel”, speech bubbles: Camilo “CTA arterial y retardada para flujo lento.” Camila “Buscamos el vaso que alimenta el saco.”
alt_text: Friendly CTA scanner with checklist bubbles for arterial and delayed phases and source-vessel hunt.

prompt: Panel 07 - CTA frames: Split view arterial vs delayed frame, delayed shows brighter blush, arrows highlighting, speech bubbles: Diego “El blush tardío confirma ingreso.” Camilo “Comparo diámetros: ¿crece el saco?”
alt_text: Split CTA frames: arterial vs delayed blush, arrows highlighting sac blush.

prompt: Panel 08 - Source vessel hunt: CT slice with colored path tracing lumbar artery into sac, magnifying glass icon, speech bubbles: Camila “Aquí entra la lumbar, mira la flecha.” Diego “Ruta lista para embolizar.”
alt_text: CT slice with colored path tracing lumbar artery into sac, magnifying glass icon.

prompt: Panel 09 - Check-in with Dr. Erben: Hallway video call tablet showing Dr. Young Erben smiling, interns thumbs-up, speech bubbles: Dr. Erben “Muestren tendencia del saco y mapa del vaso.” Camilo “Tenemos los datos listos!”
alt_text: Video call tablet with Dr. Young Erben; interns giving thumbs-up in hallway.

prompt: Panel 10 - Observation path: Green flowchart stable sac -> observe -> calendar icons, happy sac face, speech bubbles: Camila “Mitad se resuelve sola en 6 meses.” Diego “CTA seriado 3-6 meses.”
alt_text: Green flowchart: stable sac → observe; calendar icons and happy sac.

prompt: Panel 11 - Intervention path: Red flowchart sac growth -> embolization, catheter icon, speech bubbles: Camilo “Si crece >5 mm, actuamos.” Camila “Elegimos ruta: transarterial o translumbar.”
alt_text: Red flowchart: sac growth → embolization; catheter icon.

prompt: Panel 12 - Transarterial route: Microcatheter threading into lumbar artery toward sac, coils ready, speech bubbles: Diego “Microcatéter 2.0F por la lumbar.” Camilo “Coils primero, Onyx si queda flujo.”
alt_text: Microcatheter threading into lumbar artery toward sac with coils.

prompt: Panel 13 - Translumbar route: Needle from back into sac under CT guidance, shielded spine backdrop, speech bubbles: Camila “Ruta directa si arterias tortuosas.” Diego “AngioCT guía para evitar raíz lumbar.”
alt_text: Needle translumbar path into sac under CT guidance with spine backdrop.

prompt: Panel 14 - Novel idea spark: 3D sac model on table, glowing lightbulb, speech bubbles: Camilo “¿Y si usamos microburbujas persistentes?” Camila “Medimos duración del blush.”
alt_text: 3D sac model on table, glowing lightbulb; interns pointing to idea.

prompt: Panel 15 - Microbubble tracker: CEUS screen with swirling bright bubbles and timer overlay, speech bubbles: Diego “Medimos wash-in y wash-out en segundos.” Camilo “Si dura >60 s, más riesgo de crecimiento.”
alt_text: CEUS screen with bright microbubbles swirling into sac and timer overlay.

prompt: Panel 16 - Dual-phase CTA overlay: Tablet slider merging arterial and delayed frames with colored overlay, speech bubbles: Camila “Fusionamos fases para inflow exacto.” Diego “Guía directa al microcatéter.”
alt_text: Tablet slider overlaying arterial and delayed CTA frames with colored blush.

prompt: Panel 17 - Pressure monitoring: Small pressure gauge attached to sac diagram, needle drops after test, speech bubbles: Camilo “Sensor de presión en catéter.” Camila “Si cae, sabemos que sellamos.”
alt_text: Sac diagram with pressure gauge dropping after test.

prompt: Panel 18 - Outcome data wall: Poster with success rates 70-80%, recurrence 10-20%, chart arrows, speech bubbles: Diego “Resolución 70-80% con embolización selectiva.” Camilo “Recurrencia 10-20%, seguimos vigilando.”
alt_text: Poster with success rates 70-80% and recurrence 10-20% plus arrows.

prompt: Panel 19 - Patient talk: Counseling room, anatomical model, speech bubbles: Camila “No es fuga del stent, son ramas pequeñas.” Diego “Plan: vigilar, y si crece, sellar con coils o pegamento.”
alt_text: Counseling room with anatomical model; interns explaining endoleak to patient.

prompt: Panel 20 - Sterile prep: Cath lab cartoon with blue drapes, checklist floating, speech bubbles: Camilo “Checklist: anticoagulación, acceso, microcatéter.” Camila “Recuerda fluoroscopia baja dosis.”
alt_text: Cath lab prep scene with blue drapes and floating checklist.

prompt: Panel 21 - Coil deployment: Inside sac view with coils spiraling, flow stops, sparkles, speech bubbles: Diego “Coils hasta estasis; Onyx si persiste flujo lento.” Camilo “Control con angiografía final.”
alt_text: Inside sac view showing coils deployment and flow stasis sparkles.

prompt: Panel 22 - Post-procedure CTA: CTA slice without blush, green check, speech bubbles: Camila “CTA 6-12 semanas sin realce.” Diego “Diámetro estable o menor.”
alt_text: Post-procedure CTA slice without blush and green checkmark.

prompt: Panel 23 - Pilot study draft: Poster with bullet points CEUS persistence, sac pressure probe, overlay tool, speech bubbles: Camilo “Hipótesis: burbuja >60 s predice expansión.” Camila “Probamos en 20 pacientes consecutivos.”
alt_text: Poster draft listing CEUS persistence, sac pressure probe, overlay tool.

prompt: Panel 24 - Sample size debate: Table with calculator, coffee cups, speech bubbles: Diego “Poder 80%, alfa 0.05, necesitamos 34 casos.” Camilo “Agreguemos margen por pérdidas.”
alt_text: Table with calculator, coffee cups, charts for sample size discussion.

prompt: Panel 25 - Ethics reminder: IRB consent form with heart icon, speech bubbles: Camila “Consentimiento bilingüe y claro.” Diego “Riesgos mínimos, beneficio potencial alto.”
alt_text: IRB consent form with heart icon; bilingual consent reminder.

prompt: Panel 26 - Data capture: Laptop with sac diameter chart, cloud icon, speech bubbles: Camilo “Capturamos diámetro, blush time, presión.” Camila “REDCap con alertas automáticas.”
alt_text: Laptop charting sac diameter with cloud/REDCap icon.

prompt: Panel 27 - Result teaser: Poster with lines growth vs stable, bubbles labeled fast vs slow wash-out, speech bubbles: Diego “Si wash-out lento correlaciona, cambiamos algoritmo.” Camilo “Intervenimos antes en alto riesgo.”
alt_text: Poster comparing growth vs stable lines with bubble labels for wash-out speed.

prompt: Panel 28 - Teaching moment: Whiteboard bullets “localizar, medir, decidir ruta”, speech bubbles: Camila “Tres pasos: localizar, medir, ruta.” Diego “Siempre revisar fase retardada.”
alt_text: Whiteboard bullets “localizar, medir, ruta” for teaching moment.

prompt: Panel 29 - Future tech dream: Augmented reality overlay on abdomen, tablet projecting holographic artery, speech bubbles: Camilo “Sueño: AR muestra la arteria culpable.” Camila “Guía el microcatéter como GPS.”
alt_text: Augmented reality tablet projecting holographic artery over abdomen.

prompt: Panel 30 - Wrap-up with Dr. Erben: Conference room, poster presentation, speech bubbles: Dr. Erben “Ciencia clara y visual.” Diego “Listos para enrolar y publicar.”
alt_text: Conference room poster presentation with Dr. Erben; stickers and charts.

prompt: Panel 31 - Patient success: Follow-up visit, happy patient with cane, sac diagram shrinking, speech bubbles: Camila “Saco 5 mm más pequeño, sin blush.” Camilo “Seguimiento anual.”
alt_text: Follow-up visit with happy patient using cane; shrinking sac diagram.

prompt: Panel 32 - Future paper: Journal cover mock “Type 2 Endoleak Flow Dynamics”, confetti, speech bubbles: Diego “Enviamos manuscrito con cohorte y CEUS.” Camila “Compartimos modelos 3D y código.”
alt_text: Mock journal cover “Type 2 Endoleak Flow Dynamics” with confetti.
